item.title: RadioShack Files For Bankruptcy. Again
item.description: March 9, 2017 - The electronics chain closed thousands of stores in 2015 and restructured the remaining business in an attempt to stabilize sales. On Wednesday, the new parent company filed for bankruptcy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 9, 2017 - The electronics chain closed thousands of stores in 2015 and restructured the remaining business in an attempt to stabilize sales. On Wednesday, the new parent company filed for bankruptcy. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/09/519440212/radioshack-files-for-bankruptcy-again

item.title: Julian Assange Says WikiLeaks Will Share CIA Code With Tech Companies
item.description: March 9, 2017 - WikiLeaks on Tuesday disclosed the hacking tools from the so-called Vault 7 series. Now Assange says his group will be working with big manufacturers to develop fixes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 9, 2017 - WikiLeaks on Tuesday disclosed the hacking tools from the so-called Vault 7 series. Now Assange says his group will be working with big manufacturers to develop fixes. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/09/519441618/julian-assange-says-wikileaks-will-share-cia-code-with-tech-companies

item.title: Silicon Valley Leaders Raise Concerns About Latest WikiLeaks Release
item.description: March 8, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with Nico Sell, co-founder of Wickr, about the WikiLeaks documents regarding government surveillance utilizing security flaws in commonly used devices.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with Nico Sell, co-founder of Wickr, about the WikiLeaks documents regarding government surveillance utilizing security flaws in commonly used devices. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/08/519282216/silicon-valley-leaders-raise-concerns-about-latest-wikileaks-release

item.title: Researchers Take A Step Toward Mind-Controlled Robots
item.description: March 8, 2017 - Researchers have created a system where humans can guide robots with their brainwaves, signaling to the machines when they've made a mistake. It could help improve the way humans and robots interact.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - Researchers have created a system where humans can guide robots with their brainwaves, signaling to the machines when they've made a mistake. It could help improve the way humans and robots interact. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/08/519235038/researchers-take-a-step-toward-mind-controlled-robots

item.title: The CIA Document Dump Isn't Exactly Snowden 2.0. Here's Why
item.description: March 8, 2017 - The alleged CIA documents reveal a hacking program that is very different from the one uncovered by Edward Snowden's NSA leak. One distinction: Mass surveillance vs. targeted attacks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - The alleged CIA documents reveal a hacking program that is very different from the one uncovered by Edward Snowden's NSA leak. One distinction: Mass surveillance vs. targeted attacks. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/08/519205172/the-cia-document-dump-isn-t-exactly-snowden-2-0-here-s-why

item.title: WikiLeaks Documents Detail Alleged CIA Hacking Tools
item.description: March 8, 2017 - David Greene talks with Jake Williams of the cybersecurity firm Rendition InfoSec about documents released by WikiLeaks that purportedly describe tools the CIA uses to spy on electronic devices.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - David Greene talks with Jake Williams of the cybersecurity firm Rendition InfoSec about documents released by WikiLeaks that purportedly describe tools the CIA uses to spy on electronic devices. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/08/519170664/wikileaks-documents-detail-alleged-cia-hacking-tools

item.title: Syrian Psychiatrist In The U.S. Uses Online Platform To Help Mental Health Workers
item.description: March 8, 2017 - A Syrian psychiatrist who lives in the U.S. has found a way to help the thousands of people suffering from trauma back in and around his homeland.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 8, 2017 - A Syrian psychiatrist who lives in the U.S. has found a way to help the thousands of people suffering from trauma back in and around his homeland. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/08/519170588/syrian-psychiatrist-in-the-u-s-uses-online-platfrom-to-help-mental-health-worker

item.title: Why A 106-Year-Old Event Is Still Relevant In 2017
item.description:
March 7, 2017 - International Women's Day has taken on a life of its own. Here's how it's celebrated around the world.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/07/518214253/why-a-108-year-old-event-is-still-relevant-in-2017
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 7, 2017 - International Women's Day has taken on a life of its own. Here's how it's celebrated around the world. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/07/518214253/why-a-108-year-old-event-is-still-relevant-in-2017

item.title: WikiLeaks Releases What It Calls CIA Trove Of Cyber-Espionage Documents
item.description: March 7, 2017 - The release includes thousands of pages of user manuals, support guides and other documents that appear to describe CIA hacking efforts. WikiLeaks says it is choosing not to release the code itself.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 7, 2017 - The release includes thousands of pages of user manuals, support guides and other documents that appear to describe CIA hacking efforts. WikiLeaks says it is choosing not to release the code itself. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/07/519010317/wikileaks-releases-what-it-calls-cia-trove-of-cyberespionage-documents

item.title: Facebook Enlists Fact-Checkers To Probe Disputed Stories
item.description: March 7, 2017 - Facebook has been criticized for providing a platform to fake news stories, especially during the presidential campaign. It is working with independent fact-checkers to examine flagged stories.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 7, 2017 - Facebook has been criticized for providing a platform to fake news stories, especially during the presidential campaign. It is working with independent fact-checkers to examine flagged stories. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/07/518956912/facebook-enlists-fact-checkers-to-probe-disputed-stories

item.title: Energy Savings Can Be Fun, But No Need To Turn Off All The Lights
item.description: March 7, 2017 - From counting steps to hours of sleep, many people are tracking aspects of their lives. Now one company is merging energy saving with the interest in quantifying — making lowering electricity a game.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 7, 2017 - From counting steps to hours of sleep, many people are tracking aspects of their lives. Now one company is merging energy saving with the interest in quantifying — making lowering electricity a game. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/07/518175670/energy-savings-can-be-fun-but-no-need-to-turn-off-all-the-lights

item.title: FAQ: On Alleged Wiretaps Of Trump Communications
item.description: March 6, 2017 - President Trump accused his predecessor of monitoring his communications. Here is a rundown of the allegations, federal surveillance powers, and what we do and don't know.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - President Trump accused his predecessor of monitoring his communications. Here is a rundown of the allegations, federal surveillance powers, and what we do and don't know. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/06/518797121/faq-on-alleged-wire-taps-of-trump-communications

item.title: Smartphone Software Makes It Cheaper To Spy From A Distance
item.description: March 6, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Joseph Cox, a reporter for the tech website, "Motherboard," about how he tracked himself with $170 smartphone spyware that anyone can buy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Joseph Cox, a reporter for the tech website, "Motherboard," about how he tracked himself with $170 smartphone spyware that anyone can buy. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/06/518858280/smartphone-software-makes-it-cheaper-to-spy-from-a-distance

item.title: Emojis Begin Cropping Up Outside Of Your Smartphone
item.description:
March 6, 2017 - Emojis — those little cartoon figures used by some people on smartphones — have became popular as design motifs in the real world.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/03/06/518858273/emojis-begin-cropping-up-outside-of-your-smartphone
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - Emojis — those little cartoon figures used by some people on smartphones — have became popular as design motifs in the real world. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/06/518858273/emojis-begin-cropping-up-outside-of-your-smartphone

item.title: WATCH: Tracking Lightning Strikes, From Space
item.description: March 6, 2017 - NOAA's new weather satellite is carrying the first lightning detector ever parked in orbit over Earth. It has sent back its first images of real-time lightning storms in the Western Hemisphere.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - NOAA's new weather satellite is carrying the first lightning detector ever parked in orbit over Earth. It has sent back its first images of real-time lightning storms in the Western Hemisphere. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/06/518776626/watch-tracking-lightning-strikes-from-space
